intro: Chabraea fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant chabraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen stems and small, clustered leaves. Its most distinguishing feature is its fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, often emitting a sweet scent. Chabraea fragrans is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
